attributes.action: Supermarkets to sell high sugar cereals separately, in the confectionery aisle.
attributes.additional_details:
Many children consume too much sugar at breakfast, often over half their recommended daily amount (Public Health England 2017).
1 in 5 British children finishes primary school obese (NHS 2017).
The UK is Europe’s leading consumer of breakfast cereals (Bakeryand Snacks.com).
Typical supermarket Corn Flakes contain only 8% sugar.
A typical confectionery bar contains 45-50% sugar.
Breakfast cereals containing 20-39% sugar should have to be sold separately from others, in the confectionery aisle.
attributes.background: Some breakfast cereals are increasingly resembling confectionery, with many types having versions containing chocolate. Many contain between 25 - 39% sugar, are packaged to appeal to children, and are advertised on children’s TV. Meanwhile, childhood obesity rates in the UK continue to climb.

rejection.details: This petition seems to be calling on supermarkets, not the UK Government or Parliament, to take action.
